name: Emmanuel Durowoju
presentation_title: Beyond Boundaries: The Power of Connecting What We Know
outline: The Turning Point: Discovering Data and AI
intro_paragraph: Growth begins when we step beyond what we already know. Emmanuel’s journey spans Mechanical Engineering and Artificial Intelligence, showing how connecting disciplines unlocks innovation and personal growth.
speaker_intro: Emmanuel is currently pursuing his master’s in data science with a concentration in AI, after earning a master’s degree in mechanical engineering. He describes himself as a goal-getter who bridges traditional engineering and AI to solve real-world problems.
key_message: When we connect what we know with what we are willing to learn, we go beyond boundaries—and that’s where transformation begins.

name: Sahil Sandhu
intro_paragraph: Sahil’s story is about believing in yourself, trying again and again, and eventually achieving what once felt impossible.
speaker_intro: Born in India and now living in New York, Sahil once struggled with math and wanted to give up. Instead, he chose hard work and patience, eventually becoming the first child in his family to pursue higher education abroad. He now dreams of improving India’s education system and creating more creative, enjoyable learning experiences.
key_message: No matter how hard something looks, there is always a way to solve it—as long as you keep trying and never lose hope.

name: Manoj Maguluri
presentation_title: Courage, Career Change, and Personal Growth
outline: Career Transition from Mechanical to IT
Future Dream of a Food Business
intro_paragraph: Manoj’s journey is about the courage to leave stability, reskill from mechanical engineering into IT, and continue dreaming beyond a single career path.
speaker_intro: Manoj began his professional journey as a mechanical engineer in production and quality. In 2018, driven by curiosity and the desire to innovate, he shifted into IT, learned databases and IBM tools, and became a database administrator. Alongside his tech growth, he dreams of starting his own food business to blend passion and ambition.
key_message: It’s not where you start, but the courage to change that leads to success.

name: Abdullah Siraj
presentation_title: How Building Stuff Teaches You New Things
intro_paragraph: Abdullah believes that the best way to learn is to build—taking things apart, experimenting, and creating new solutions.
speaker_intro: Abdullah is pursuing a master’s in computer information systems with a concentration in AI. With a background in Computer Science, he’s driven by curiosity, loves building things, and wants to design smarter systems. A coffee-loving night owl, he sees building as the path to learning.
key_message: When you build things, you don’t just create projects—you create new versions of yourself as a learner and problem-solver.

name: Karthik Kallu
presentation_title: A Story of Resilience and Growth
outline: Early Life and Education in India
Academic and Professional Growth in the UK
intro_paragraph: Karthik’s journey moves across India, the UK, and the US, highlighting resilience, adaptability, and the courage to restart when life demands it.
speaker_intro: Karthik earned a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science in India, completed a Master’s in Business Management in the UK, and worked as a Java developer for three years. After feeling unsafe and uncertain about his future there, he made the hard decision to leave and start over in the United States, where he is now pursuing another master’s degree.
key_message: Growth begins when we step out of our comfort zone and trust ourselves enough to start again.

name: Mohammad Affan
presentation_title: Life Is Like a Two-Wheeler: You Move Only When You Push
intro_paragraph: Mohammad uses the metaphor of a two-wheeler to show that life only moves forward when we keep pushing, no matter the obstacles.
speaker_intro: Mohammad is passionate about AI and wants to become an AI engineer focused on Agentic AI—systems that can think and act with more independence. His dream is to make healthcare in India more affordable and accessible.
key_message: Progress happens when we push forward, even when it’s hard—just like riding a scooter that only moves when you keep going.

name: Mansoor Ahmed
presentation_title: How Building Stuff Teaches You New Things
intro_paragraph: Mansoor’s story focuses on how building things, guided by strong values and inspiration from his father, teaches discipline, creativity, and purpose.
speaker_intro: Mansoor draws deep inspiration from his father’s example of hard work and consistency. He aspires to become a software engineer and build meaningful solutions that make a positive difference in people’s lives.
key_message: Building with purpose—shaped by values and persistence—helps you grow into the person you want to be.
